profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-06 23:48:51 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: This collection contains the records of the Tufts University Art Gallery.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of their creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trustees records are open for research.
Records containing information related to student education, staff and faculty employment, and Board of Trustees records are closed for 75 years from the date of creation.
This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Tufts University Gallery, 2009-2019.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection arranged in three series: Additional accessions, 2017 accessions, and 2019 accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Tufts University Art Gallery animates the intellectual life of the greater university community through exhibitions and programs exploring new, global perspectives on art and on art discourse. The Tufts University Art Gallery's exhibition space consists of the Tisch and Koppelman Galleries, the Remis Sculpture Court, a projection wall for short video and film works, and the Slater Concourse Gallery (Tufts' community gallery).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tufts University Gallery Records, 1979-2019. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: 2017 accessions were processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Leah Edelman in 2017. Materials were placed in archival boxes if the orignal housing was damaged, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Received order was maintained. A file-level inventory and series-level description were created and the finding aid was updated at the time of processing. 2019 accessions of digital materials were processed by Digital Archivist Margaret Peachy in 2019. A file-level inventory and series-level description were created and the finding aid was updated at the time of processing.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have been transferred to Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains office files and exhibit files of the Tufts University Art Gallery, including: grant files, foundation files, contracts, other financial information; MFA thesis and museum studies files; subject files; and loans and condition reports. The exhibit files contain slides and photographs. There are also two boxes containing mostly VHS tapes of exhibition videos and educational films, as well as unmarked VHS tapes. One of these boxes contains 2 Umatic cassettes of "A Day in Warsaw" from the International center for Jewish Film, dated 1991 and 1992 respectively.

arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trustees records are open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Tufts University Gallery, 2017, accession UA-2017-056 and UA-2017-057.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains Tufts University Art Gallery office files, including grant files, foundation files, contracts, and other financial information. This series also contains exhibition files, MFA thesis and museum studies files, and loans and condition reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials relating to the Alumnae Murals, including copies of archival source materials, a bibliography and readings, images of the murals, object file information about the murals, the object file itself, and copies of presentations given during a forum on December 20, 2017. This accession also includes two WARC files created by the Digital Archivist using WebRecorder to capture a 360 degree video of the murals created by the Art Gallery, and a website on the murals.

Materials were compiled and files created between 2017 and 2019. Files include scans and copies of materials created earlier, including archival materials held by Digital Collections and Archives in UA021, Facilities Management Records.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Materials in the "Archival Scans" folder were copied from Facilities Management Records, 1849-2004. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Items in the "Web Crawls" folder must be viewed using Web Recorder. A Box Note with instructions on how to download and use Web Recorder can be found in the same folder.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Dina Deitsch, 2019, accession UA-2019-026.
